meanings.definition: To dive or plunge into water.
meanings.sent1: The brave swimmer decided to plonge into the pool from the diving board.
meanings.sent2: She loves to plonge into the ocean waves during her beach vacations.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to plonge into the bathtub during bath time.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the sky seemed to plonge into darkness.
meanings.sent5: The daredevil's plonge off the cliff was captured on camera.

meanings.sent1: The submarine made a plonge into the depths of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The explorer's plonge into the underwater cave revealed hidden treasures.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plonge of the stock market left investors worried.
meanings.sent4: Her heart took a plonge when she saw the surprise party waiting for her.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster's sudden plonge made everyone scream in excitement.

meanings.sent1: The hiker was startled by the steep plonge of the trail.
meanings.sent2: The plonge of the temperature caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent3: The plonge of the elevator made her stomach lurch.
meanings.sent4: The plonge of the waterfall created a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent5: The plonge of the airplane before landing made her ears pop.
